text: Aspergillus nakazawae (also named A. pallidofulvus) is a species of fungus in the genus Aspergillus. It is from the Circumdati section. The species was first described in 1950.Sakaguchi, Iizuka & M. Yamazaki 1950, J. appl. Mycol., Japan 4(1): 3 It has been reported to produce aspergamide A, aspergamide B, notoamides, penicillic acid, mellein, 4-hydroxy mellein, xanthomegnin, viomellein, aspyrone, and neoaspergillic acid. ==Growth and morphology== A. nakazawae has been cultivated on both Czapek yeast extract agar (CYA) plates and Malt Extract Agar Oxoid® (MEAOX) plates. The growth morphology of the colonies can be seen in the pictures below. Aspergillus_nakazawae_cya.png|Aspergillus nakazawae growing on CYA plate Aspergillus_nakazawae_meaox.png|Aspergillus nakazawae growing on MEAOX plate == References == nakazawae Category:Fungi described in 1950
title: Aspergillus nakazawae
